org.itadaki.bzip2

Class BZip2BitInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.itadaki.bzip2.BZip2BitInputStream

  • public class BZip2BitInputStream
extends java.lang.Object

    An InputStream wrapper that allows the reading of single bit booleans, unary numbers, bit strings of arbitrary length (up to 24 bits), and bit aligned 32-bit integers. A single byte at a time is read from the wrapped stream when more bits are required

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BZip2BitInputStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream)

      int readBits(int count)
      Reads up to 24 bits from the wrapped input stream

      Reads a single bit from the wrapped input stream
      int readInteger()
      Reads 32 bits of input as an integer
      int readUnary()
      Reads a zero-terminated unary number from the wrapped input stream

      • BZip2BitInputStream

        public BZip2BitInputStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • readBoolean

        public boolean readBoolean()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a single bit from the wrapped input stream
        Returns:
        true if the bit read was 1, otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if no more bits are available in the input stream

      • readUnary

        public int readUnary()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a zero-terminated unary number from the wrapped input stream
        Returns:
        The unary number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if no more bits are available in the input stream

      • readBits

        public int readBits(int count)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads up to 24 bits from the wrapped input stream
        Parameters:
        count - The number of bits to read (maximum 24)
        Returns:
        The bits requested, right-aligned within the integer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if more bits are requested than are available in the input stream

      • readInteger

        public int readInteger()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads 32 bits of input as an integer
        Returns:
        The integer read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if 32 bits are not available in the input stream
